channel.title: R on Jeff Cavanagh
channel.description: Recent content in R on Jeff Cavanagh

item.title: Processing Text Data
item.description: stringr The Data Cleaning Text Data Breaking Down Text Data Word Analysis Text data cannot be processed identically to numerical or categorical data. Is there a way then to analyze text data and obtain insight from it?? Of course! All it takes is an adapted approach and a little more work upfront. Quite a bit of potential data is unstructured and textual in nature.To extract the underlying value of this category of data, different techniques are required.

item.title: Web Scraping
item.description: Setup CSS Tool Data rvest Selenium Unfortunately, not all data is contained within neat data frames. There is a virtually unlimited amount of data contained within web pages, but extracting and manipulated that information into a usable and familiar format is a major obstacle. This post will serve as an introduction on how to extract data from web pages using R and Python with the packages rvest and Selenium.

item.title: Hiking Trail Analysis
item.description: Setup Partitioning the Data Interaction of Predictor Variables Model Building Linear Regression LDA QDA Logistic Regression KNN Cross Validation Tree-Based Methods Bagging Random Forest GBM Classification Predictions The following was my final project for a Predictive Analytics course. It analyzed data on hiking trails throughout the US and created and compared models predicting whether or not a given trail will be rated above 4.

item.title: Statistical Modeling Starter Kit
item.description: Setup Regression Models Simple Linear Regression Multiple Linear Regression Classification models Logistic Regression Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) Quadratic Discriminant Analysis (QDA) K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) Cross-Validation This post will cover some basic methods of regression analysis and how to apply them in R. It will also serve as a warm-up for the posts that explore more advanced machine learning and AI methods.
